appear.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used when saying how someone or something seems. Appear is more formal than seem
appear.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
It may be less useful than it first appears.
The diamonds appeared to be genuine.
The research appears to show that the drug is effective in most cases.
He didn't appear to me to be a violent man.
It appears that all the files have been deleted.
There appears to be some kind of problem.
During the interview she appeared calm and relaxed.
I don’t want to appear rude.
appear.translation[0].definitions[0].not: Appear is a linking verb This type of verb links the subject of the sentence with an adjective or noun
Appear is not used in the progressive in this meaning You say
He is appearing to be unhappy
appear.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to start to be seen, to arrive, or to exist in a place, especially suddenly
appear.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Two faces appeared at our window.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Small cracks appeared in the wall.
It was nearly an hour before Sweeney appeared in the pub.
The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
appear.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to take part in a film, play, concert, television programme etc
appear.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: She has already appeared in a number of films.
He appeared on national television to deny the claims.
appear.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to be written or shown on a list, in a book or newspaper, in a document etc
appear.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The story appeared in all the national newspapers.
Some of the material used has appeared in print before  (=has been published).
appear.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to become widely available or known about
appear.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The new range will be appearing in shops in the autumn.
New courses are appearing every year.
appear.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to go to a law court or other official meeting to give information, answer questions etc
appear.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: The three men are due to appear in court tomorrow.
She appeared before Colchester magistrates charged with attempted murder.
Sir Nicholas Gammon QC appeared on behalf of the defendant.
appear for somebody/on behalf of somebody
appear.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: appear
to start to be seen, especially suddenly
A few small white clouds appeared on the horizon.
pop up
to appear very suddenly
A woman’s face popped up from the other side of the fence.
become visible
to gradually start to be able to be seen
The shape of the baby’s head gradually became visible on the screen.
come into view
if something comes into view, you start to see it as you move closer to it, or it gets closer to you
The white cliffs of Dover came into view.
come out
if the sun, moon, or the stars come out, they suddenly appear
The sun came out from behind a cloud.
loom/loom up
if a large frightening object or person looms, they appear suddenly
The dark shape of the castle loomed up out of the mist.
The man’s face suddenly loomed over him.
resurface
to appear again after being lost or missing
The girl’s father has resurfaced after six years of no contact.
